title: Integrated Hardware Simulation Education Program for Electrical Engineering

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary electrical circuit theory and basic MATLAB software proficiency
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing intuitive understanding of physical operating principles in electrical systems through hardware simulations resembling real-world scenarios. Modular design is required to address individual learning pace differences in BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Implement a power system model with over 85% accuracy using TIMS simulation hardware
Quantitatively evaluate differences from real systems through comparative experiments conducted at least three times based on simulation results

Learners will analyze three simulation-based problems (e.g., process optimization, quality control) occurring in industrial settings through team projects (four members per team), write a project report including problem definitions and solutions, and achieve a grade of B or higher in at least four of five evaluation criteria during the final presentation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
